properties.areaDesc: Christian, MO; Webster, MO; Douglas, MO; Wright, MO
properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 17 at 11:39PM CST until January 18 at 8:30AM CST by NWS Springfield MO
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Springfield has issued a

* Flood Warning for...
Webster County in southwestern Missouri...
Douglas County in southwestern Missouri...
Wright County in southwestern Missouri...
Eastern Christian County in southwestern Missouri...

* Until 830 AM CST Saturday.

* At 1136 PM CST, Doppler radar and weather observations indicated
prolonged moderate to heavy rain that will cause flooding. Up to
one inch of rain has already fallen with another inch possible in
some areas.

* Creeks, streams, and low water crossings will be especially
susceptible to the dangers of flooding.
Locations in the warning include...
Marshfield...                     Mountain Grove...
Rogersville...                    Ava...
Seymour...                        Mansfield...
Fordland...                       Dawson...
Norwood...                        Hartville...
Niangua...                        Duncan...
Diggins...                        Elkland...
Oldfield...                       Manes...
Brushyknob...                     Elkhead...
Grovespring...                    Rome...

This warning includes but is not limited to the following low water
crossings...
Route E north of Highway 38 at The Gasconade River...
Route FF at Hunter Creek east of Ava...
Route FF at Turkey Creek east of Ava...
Greenwood Road at The Pomme de Terre Headwaters...
and Route Y at Cowskin Creek 3 miles west of Ava.

Farm Road 174 just east of Rogersville High School in southern
Webster County was reported flooded by a spotter at 1118 pm.
properties.instruction:
A Flood Warning means that flooding is imminent or occurring. All
interested parties should take necessary precautions immediately.
